medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent abdominal distention, vomiting, and diarrhea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The boy initially had colicky reactions to breast-feeding. Vomiting occurred at nine months of age and resolved. Diarrhea began nine days after the vomiting resolved, resulting in five to seven stools each day for two days before resolution. He lost 1.4 kg of body weight by 11 months of age and experienced intermittent foul-smelling diarrhea approximately every 7 to 10 days. Two days before admission, he exhibited persistent diarrhea, decreased oral intake, and increasing lethargy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The boy was born at 34 weeksâ€™ gestation and was admitted to the newborn intensive care unit for three days but had an unremarkable course. He had a history of iron-deficiency anemia.
medical_history.family_history: The mother had ulcerative colitis for 22 years, which was controlled with hydrocortisone. Recent examinations showed granulomatous lesions in the distal ileum.
